page.title: 09A Longnor Joiner's Day
page.content: Philip Kidd gets up at 8 o'clock. He gets dressed and feeds the poultry and wildfowl. Then he has his breakfast. He then goes up to the workshop to work. Philip is a joiner. He makes stairs, windows, doors, etc. Philip has one worker and he pays a builder who is building the mill and also helps him. He has a series of machines - tenenors, drills, planers, bandsaws, etc. He uses chisels, hammers, planes, etc. All his work is done by hand, but in 100 years time it will probably be done by machines. Philip buys wood from a company but he sometimes cuts trees down himself and cuts them into planks using a very big saw. He leaves them outside to dry out which will take about 6 to 7 years. He owns a saw mill. The wheel still works. Philip works until about 10 o'clock at night.
